1063839749662752768.text: Building the future takes time and effort. We need people in government to believe in a better future, people in science to drive technology forward, people in the community to shelter those already affected. Hope is just the beginning. So get out there. Build your utopia.

1063839573845962752.text: If you're afraid of what the world is becoming, try to change that. Study sustainability so that you can create a better system. Campaign for anti-climate change charities. Donate to relief aid for countries that are already being flooded. Invent ways to change the world.

1063839509446569984.text: The fight for a better future starts with daring to hope and imagining what that future would look like. I believe fiction has a responsibility to provide this. But that's just the beginning. We are stuck in a system wherein we are granted little power, but let's use what we have

1063839430971146240.text: I've been thinking a lot about hope. As wildfires rage, sea levels rise, and we slowly bake and freeze in equal measure, it's easy to see these problems as insurmountable. We are pre-post-apocalyptic. And it's so easy to give up. But that's the last thing we should do.

975876949640974336.text: #LegendsOfTomorrow may not get a lot of attention, but it is quietly revolutionary, bringing queer representation to an otherwise LGBT unfriendly genre. And I'm very grateful for that.

975876766773497856.text: Finally, Ava and Sara's romance doesn't make a big deal over the fact they're both women — it's just a normal time-traveling love story. Ava herself is a fantastic addition to the show and an excellent (ironically) straight man to the Legends’ wacky antics.

975876519166926850.text: ...Constantine's bisexuality was ignored yet again. When fans demanded to know why, they were met with ridicule from the showrunner (at SDCC 2014). Legends, though, casually allowed Constantine his bisexuality, aligning with canon and giving fans the representation they deserve.

975876091389890562.text: Ah, Constantine. Legends confirming him as bi was a triumph against queer erasure. Constantine's sexuality has been fought over for years: revealed in the Vertigo comic then ignored, unearthed only to be erased again as DC added him to main continuity. When it came to his show...

975875395701608453.text: Then there's Snart. Wentworth Miller played him with enough camp to set off all our subtext-gaydars, and Snart's gay alternate universe self was a validating gift to the show, introduced in a crossover that made up for the superhero genre's otherwise lack of queer representation.

975875061667151872.text: I'm super excited that Constantine's joining S4, so let's talk about how @TheCW_Legends has some of the best #LGBT representation on TV.
